title.native: シンカリオン チェンジ ザ ワールド

description:
"Unknown" is a mysterious enemy that suddenly appeared a long time ago. As a countermeasure, the "Evolutionary Railway Development Agency" (ERDA) has developed the "Shinkalion" robot that transform into bullet trains, to prepare for the threat.

"I want to be a cool person who can protect something..." Taisei Oonari, a second-year junior high school student, transfers to Shinkai Gakuen Middle School in search of clues about his older sister who disappeared two years ago.

Just then, the Unknown appears for the first time in 10 years. Taisei happens to have a high aptitude value as a Shinkalion pilot, and is forced to make a decision to fight it. What is the true nature of the Unknown and what is its purpose? What is the truth that comes to light at the end of the fight? The story of the boys' determination and growth begins now.

(Source: Official Website, translated)

Note: Relations are provisional and will be updated when more info is announced.
hashtag: #シンカリオンCW #シンカリオン
synonyms: 新幹線変形ロボ シンカリオン チェンジ ザ ワールド
Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion: Change the World

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

Gre4n Boyz (stylized as GRe4N BOYZ) is a Japanese pop rock/hip hop/breakbeat vocal group from Kooriyama in Fukushima Prefecture, comprising the all-male four members Hide, Navi, Kuni (written as "92"), and Soh.

On March 19, 2024, the group announced a significant change by altering their name upon leaving their previous agency, High Speed Boy.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[__Website__ ](http://yamamotosayaka.jp/) | [__Twitter__ ](https://twitter.com/sayakaneon) | [__Instagram__ ](https://www.instagram.com/sayaka__714/)

Sayaka Yamamoto is a Japanese singer and songwriter most widely known for her work as a former member of the Japanese idol girl group NMB48, where she served as the leader of the group and as the captain of Team N. She is also a former member of AKB48's Team K. She made her debut as a solo artist in October 2016 with her first album "Rainbow" while she was still a NMB48 member.

[Website](https://www.alfee.com/)

A Japanese rock band formed in Tokyo in 1973. Originally a folk quartet, they became a trio of bassist Masaru Sakurai, acoustic guitarist Kounosuke Sakazaki and electric guitarist Toshihiko Takamizawa in 1975. With all three performing vocal duties, they adopted a harder rock sound in the early 1980s. Beginning with their 16th single "Marie-Anne" in 1983, they have released 57 consecutive top 10 singles. The Alfee hold the record for most concerts performed by a Japanese band, with 2,888 as of December 2023.

__[Profile](http://barnstorm-design-labo.com/member/miyao.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sbs_miyao)__ __Yoshikazu Miyao__ is a Japanese director, mechanical designer, episode director and storyboard artist. He currently works for studio Gonzo, and is affiliated with [Barnstorm Design Labo](https://anilist.co/staff/146502/Barnstorm-Design-Labo).
CG designer working for Shogakukan Music & Digital Entertainment.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shie_wasano/)

Yoshie Wasano is a Brazilian 2D artist based in Kanagawa Prefecture. She has experience in projects related to games, animation, and graphic design. In 2023, she debuted at [Recess Studio](https://recess.co.jp/works/), where she worked as a background artist.

Since childhood, Yoshie has been heavily influenced by the films of Studio Ghibli, which she watched repeatedly. Initially, she had the opportunity to work on projects such as "Solo Leveling", focusing primarily on background coloring.

Yoshie used to teach Japanese as a hobby, however she now instead offers coloring courses through Instagram, helping others develop their skills in digital art.
